sentences.sContent: And we recognize the progress we have made together: gains in literacy and life expectancy… the spread of knowledge and technology...
sentences.sContent_eng: And we recognize the progress we have made together: gains in literacy and life expectancy… the spread of knowledge and technology...
sentences.sCn: 我们肯定我们共同取得的进展：文盲减少了，预期寿命增加了…… 知识和技术得到了传播……

sentences.sContent: Over the past 25 years, life expectancy after 50 has risen in the United States, but at a slower rate than in countries like Japan and Australia, said the National Academy of Sciences report.
sentences.sContent_eng: Over the past 25 years, life expectancy after 50 has risen in the United States, but at a slower rate than in countries like Japan and Australia, said the National Academy of Sciences report.
sentences.sCn: 在过去的25年中，美国人超过50岁的平均寿命有所增加，但是与日本、澳大利亚这样的国家相比其增长速度还是很低，美国国家科学院报道说。

sentences.sContent: Even Libya and Iran do well in this long-term assessment despite very low or even negative growth because they saw very rapid advances in life expectancy and school enrollments.
sentences.sContent_eng: Even Libya and Iran do well in this long-term assessment despite very low or even negative growth because they saw very rapid advances in life expectancy and school enrollments.
sentences.sCn: 甚至，增长率很低甚至是负增长的利比亚和伊朗在长期评估上都很不错。 这是因为他们在预期寿命以及入学率方面有了长足进展。

trans.tranOther: the length of time that a person or animal is expected to live
